intro: Platystele jamboeensis, commonly known as the Jamboean ghost plant, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial epiphytic plant native to the cloud forests of western Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that form a rosette, creating a unique microhabitat for small organisms. It produces tiny, white flowers that are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Due to its restricted habitat and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered endangered and faces significant conservation challenges.
